item.title: Elena add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Elena add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elena add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Elena add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Elena add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You donâ€™t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Elena add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Elena add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Elena add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Elena add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Elena add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Elena add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elena add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Elena add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "If I had a flower for every time I thought of you...I could walk through my garden forever." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Elena add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Elena add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Elena add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Ever notice how 'What the hell' is always the right answer?" -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Elena add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Elena add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Elena add a quote by William Styron
item.description: "A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading." -- William Styron

item.title: Elena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Elena add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Elena add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Elena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Coincidence is God's way of remaining anonymous." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Elena add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Elena add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elena add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Elena add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Elena add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Faith is taking the first step even when you can't see the whole staircase." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Elena add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing." -- Socrates

item.title: Elena add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein
